description: These are personal picks of Cobes-3/whyayala. These include god rolls, rare rolls, and meme rolls.
name: Personal Picks

data.description: Avoid Charge Time Masterwork with Liquid Coils. They offset each other and net you 0 gains. Otherwise, super cool rare drop that has some strong damage rolls available. Focus on Handling and then Range to make it snappy and push damage fall off out.
data.name: Overflowed Mag Roll.

data.description: Avoid Charge Time Masterwork with Liquid Coils. They offset each other and net you 0 gains. Otherwise, super cool rare drop that has some strong damage rolls available. Focus on anything but Handling since Threat Detector will max out Handling at full stacks.
data.name: Threat Detector Roll

data.description: Any Masterwork except for Reload. Outlaw will make this gun reload super fast, you just have to land precision kills. Enlightened Action is more forgiving and adds Handling, but it doesn't get a reload scalar. Elemental Capacitor on Solar builds will increase Reload.
data.name: High Reload Roll

data.description: Any Masterwork except Stability. Encore and Heating up will increase Stability with final blows. Elemental Capacitor on Void builds will increase Stability passively.
data.name: High Stability Roll

data.description: Everything in third column is serviceable in pvp in some way.
data.name: 6v6 Roll

data.description: More focused on neutral game perks for 3s.
data.name: 3v3 Roll

data.description: FTTC pairs well with Warden's Law since it fires two burst shots allowing you to proc the mag refill more frequently. If you can't get that, Enlightened Action is a good alternative for bumping your reload speed. I would avoid any mags or chambers that boost recoil direction as it really does not need the boost with having near perfect recoil pattern already. I would NOT go with Extended Mag as the reload stat is already a full 3 seconds at base and even with full stacks of enlightened action you're looking at ~2.4 seconds to reload. Unless you have some other way to proc a reload scaler, or you lean all the way into reload, it just doesn't seem worth it to me
data.name: The Lucky Pants Roll

data.description: FTTC pairs well with Warden's Law since it fires two burst shots allowing you to proc the mag refill more frequently. If you can't get that, Enlightened Action is a good alternative for bumping your reload speed. If you get Discord going you will get a free reload on kill. I would avoid any mags or chambers that boost recoil direction as it really does not need the boost with having near perfect recoil pattern already. I would NOT go with Extended Mag as the reload stat is already a full 3 seconds at base and even with full stacks of enlightened action you're looking at ~2.4 seconds to reload. Unless you have some other way to proc a reload scaler, or you lean all the way into reload, it just doesn't seem worth it to me
data.name: The General Roll

data.description: FTTC pairs well with Warden's Law since it fires two burst shots allowing you to proc the mag refill more frequently. If you can't get that, Enlightened Action is a good alternative for bumping your reload speed. I would avoid any mags or chambers that boost recoil direction as it really does not need the boost with having near perfect recoil pattern already. I would NOT go with Extended Mag as the reload stat is already a full 3 seconds at base and even with full stacks of enlightened action you're looking at ~2.4 seconds to reload. Unless you have some other way to proc a reload scaler, or you lean all the way into reload, it just doesn't seem worth it to me
data.name: The Lucky Pants Roll

Unless you have some other way to proc a reload scaler, or you lean all the way into reload, it just doesn't seem worth it to me
data.name: The General Roll

data.description: Kill Clip + Rapid Hit and a Range Masterwork is the play if you want to fuck up some one's Gambit match from an unreasonable range. Going to just go ahead and say Arrowhead Brake is mandatory.
data.name: The Invader Roll

data.description: If you're wanting to maximize damage and mag, you need to focus on perks that reward hits, not kills. Veist Stinger has a 4 second cooldown, so I wouldn't add any perk that will decrease your fire rate, because you just increase the number of shots that won't proc it. The handling is pretty damn low, so if you want it to be snappy after reloads, bring that up. If you put Vorpal Weapon on this gun, you're a basic bitch.
data.name: The DPS Roll

data.description: If you're running a Threadling build (Warlock) this could be useful for Threadling synergy. The perk combos reward precision kills. So land your shots.
data.name: The Threadling Roll

data.description: What many players slept on about Taraxippos was the fact that it can roll gutshot straight with explosive payload. Both perks provide buffs to bodyshot damage. You might think that's not worth it, but explosive payloads explosion damage is always treated as body shot damage. So, when landing a crit, the explosive damage gets buffed twice. When landing a bodyshot, the damage is close to a crit shot at base. Spec into Stability and Recoil to keep your shots true and maximize its damage profile.
data.name: Gutshot Payload Roll

data.description: Not all of these combos are optimal, but the main thing to try and focus is high Handling and high Reload/high Mag.
data.name: One-Two Punch Rolls

data.description: Trench Barrel, Frenzy and Collective Action are easy to proc (depending on build). I would focus on Range since you're not necessarily up close all the time like you would be with One-Two Punch
data.name: Slay Out Roll

data.description: There's an absurdist amount of combinations for this weapon. From void synergy, to general ad clear capability. All with a free stat boost from the Omolon trait and third column perks to top them off. It's hard to pick just one. For barrel and mag, I would go heavy on Range.
data.name: Ad Clear Rolls

data.description: These rolls are targeted on swapping between another weapon back and forth to focus stronger enemies with quick burst damage. More ideal for Champions.
data.name: Swap and Focus Rolls

data.description: Stability on mnk feels like its a must because sidearms bounce a ton. Handling would come next since this is a Tex Mechanica gun and they get a stat boost for landing hip fire shots.

With the effects of 4-Timer Refit and Vorpal Weapon, you can keep sustained damage on a Champion or Boss without being reliant on Heavy. I wouldn't take away from Stability, but I also don't think it needs investment. Nor does range. Even if you try to top it out with Barrel and Mag, you're only getting two more meters of ADS distance. So that leaves Reload and Handling. I think Reload needs more help at base, then you can focus on Handling. You don't want to ignore Handling altogether because when you get Hunter's Trace up, you want to get scoped in fast.
data.name: Boss and Champion Damage

data.description: 100 Range intrinsically. Enough said.
data.name: 3v3
